page.title: 07STUDLAND CHURCH
page.content: St Nicholas' Church is situated near the centre of the village.It may have been founded by St Aldhem on the site of a pagan temple.The Norman building is low and solid in aspect,its central tower squat and apparently unfinished. The chancel is dimly lit though more light was introduced by the widening of the window in the 17th century. The roof is supported by decorated Norman crossed-vaulting which rests on cushioned capitals. Outside the tower has been buttressed.The stone walls of the church are covered in places with attractive red lichen. The church stands in the midst of a well tended grave yard.
